title: Quiz 5: Vital Health Statistics
description: Challenge yourself with statistical definitions and vital rate calculations essential for community assessment.

questions.question: Calculate the **Crude Birth Rate (CBR)** if there were 750,000 births in a population of 15,000,000.
questions.hint: Divide births by population, then multiply by 1000.

questions.question: Match the descriptive statistic to its definition:

pairs.right: Score at the exact center (50th percentile)
Total sum divided by number of scores (average)
Difference between highest and lowest score

questions.question: The ___BLANK___ measures new cases of a disease during a period, while ___BLANK___ measures all existing cases (new and old) at a specific time.
questions.explanation: Incidence = New cases; Prevalence = All cases.

questions.question: What is the area from where most of the patients in a health facility come from called?
questions.explanation: The Catchment Area is the geographic area served by a health facility.

questions.question: Review the data below. Which village has a higher **Malaria Case Rate**?

richContent.content:
DataVillage AVillage B
Population2,0006,000
Malaria Cases100150

questions.explanation: Village A: (100/2000)*1000 = 50. Village B: (150/6000)*1000 = 25. Village A is higher.

questions.question: Which of the following are sources of demographic information? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Census, Civil Registration, and Hospital Records are official data sources. Personal diaries are not.

questions.question: A census in Kenya is typically carried out every 5 years.
questions.explanation: A census is carried out every **10 years** (decennially).

questions.question: What does a population pyramid with a broad base indicate?

options.text: High birth rate / many young children

questions.explanation: A broad base indicates a large number of children, implying a high birth rate.
questions.hint: The base represents the youngest age group.

questions.question: The ___BLANK___ Death Rate measures the number of deaths per 1000 population in a year.
questions.explanation: Crude Death Rate (CDR) is the general death rate.

questions.question: If CBR is 5% and CDR is 1.5%, what is the Population Growth Rate?
